text.p: These are the headlines for selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Megacity trustees ruled illegal: Court backs challenge to appointments, but Leach says ruling won't affect plans.
- Seniors face care shortage: Ontario waiting lists top 16,000; funding cuts cited as main factor.
- Fewer doctors foreseen in future: Review points to reduced demand.
- London's Tube may go private: Subway system next on Major's list.
- Sale of Indian lands tainted by cunning, federal report says: Commissioners recommend compensation for 1907 deal.
- Report cites accident risk at nuclear stations: Sleeping employees, computer games, unsafe operation among dangers found at Ontario Hydro plants.
- Baton takes control of CTV: Station swap with CHUM gives private network a controlling shareholder for first time.
- Skalbania roller coaster swoops downhill again: Today's sentencing for a C$100,000 theft could put the colorful entrepreneur in jail.
- Magwood out in shakeup at OMERS: Realty subsidiary's board is eliminated.
- Canadian Airlines gets creditor deal: But Ottawa feud threatens bailout.
- Baton wins CTV control: After four-station with CHUM, Baton will grab 84.5 percent of the English-speaking TV market, putting it second only to the CBC in national coverage.
- Land claim threatens Royal Oak's Kemess project.
